_source.text: (10:01 AM ET) SAN FRANCISCO (MarketWatch) -- Airline shares rose in early trading Tuesday, helped by a better-than-expected report by United Airlines' parent UAL Corp. UAL, -1.53% and a drop in crude oil prices below $74 a barrel.

text: by a **better**-**than**-expected report by United Airlines' parent UAL Corp. UAL, -1.53% and a drop in crude oil prices below $74 a **barrel**.
